Title: SAN DIEGO REALTORS
Article: A collection of projects delivered to San Diego's premier brokers, through iStrategy, where we had created the first MLS data-mining logic ever, built by the brilliant wunderkind, Karl Garske. Each project had to be served on a custom framework using the ancient 'microsoft web classes' methodology. very inflexible, but I am proud of what we achieved.

Title: CAMRY PRELAUNCH
Article: Displaying a collection of images in a new way is always a fun project. The key is to let the photography dictate to you, through its aesthetic, how to best transition. Custom code is necessary.

Title: ADOMO
Article: This project was done for an italian marketing company that decided to hire a kid out of San Francisco to give them a look. I enjoy how designs can break through communication barriers during discovery.

Title: NITTO TIRES
Article: If you can get past the bad design elements, there was a neat technical challenge in building this configurator. All values carried over to a flash multiplayer-game that I cannot run anymore.

Title: WHY TUNDRA
Article: This project is showcased due to the very fast turnaround that it required, one week. Requirements included video encoding, editing, approval changes, and SEO tracking.

Title: INFINITI SUMMER
Article: I originally invented the online-360 car-configurator, which is too complex to showcase here, but this project was when i first came up with the core idea for it using preloaded images.

Title: SATURN HOMEPAGE
Article: A car company's homepage needs to be very small and light, since it can be hit by hundreds of thousands of users concurrently. This animation managed to deliver alot of content in under 1MB, sequentially loaded.

Title: TACOMA
Article: In 2004, there was very little in the way of real streaming video on the web. Toyota challenged me with making it so, none-the-less. For its time, this was a big deal.
